 282          """ 
 283          Sends an email using data specified in constructor 
 284   
 285          Arguments: 
 286   
 287              to: list or tuple of receiver addresses; will also accept single 
 288                  object 
 289              subject: subject of the email 
 290              message: email body text; depends on type of passed object: 
 291                       if 2-list or 2-tuple is passed: first element will be 
 292                       source of plain text while second of html text; 
 293                       otherwise: object will be the only source of plain text 
 294                       and html source will be set to None; 
 295                       If text or html source is: 
 296                       None: content part will be ignored, 
 297                       string: content part will be set to it, 
 298                       file-like object: content part will be fetched from 
 299                                         it using it's read() method 
 300              attachments: list or tuple of Mail.Attachment objects; will also 
 301                           accept single object 
 302              cc: list or tuple of carbon copy receiver addresses; will also 
 303                  accept single object 
 304              bcc: list or tuple of blind carbon copy receiver addresses; will 
 305                  also accept single object 
 306              reply_to: address to which reply should be composed 
 307              encoding: encoding of all strings passed to this method (including 
 308                        message bodies) 
 309              headers: dictionary of headers to refine the headers just before 
 310                       sending mail, e.g. {'Return-Path' : 'bounces@example.org'} 
 311   
 312          Examples: 
 313   
 314              #Send plain text message to single address: 
 315              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 316                        'Message subject', 
 317                        'Plain text body of the message') 
 318   
 319              #Send html message to single address: 
 320              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 321                        'Message subject', 
 322                        '<html>Plain text body of the message</html>') 
 323   
 324              #Send text and html message to three addresses (two in cc): 
 325              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 326                        'Message subject', 
 327                        ('Plain text body', '<html>html body</html>'), 
 328                        cc=['other1@example.com', 'other2@example.com']) 
 329   
 330              #Send html only message with image attachment available from 
 331              the message by 'photo' content id: 
 332              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 333                        'Message subject', 
 334                        (None, '<html><img src="cid:photo" /></html>'), 
 335                        Mail.Attachment('/path/to/photo.jpg' 
 336                                        content_id='photo')) 
 337   
 338              #Send email with two attachments and no body text 
 339              mail.send('you@example.com, 
 340                        'Message subject', 
 341                        None, 
 342                        [Mail.Attachment('/path/to/fist.file'), 
 343                         Mail.Attachment('/path/to/second.file')])

 345          Returns True on success, False on failure. 
 346   
 347          Before return, method updates two object's fields:

 471          if cipher_type == 'gpg':

 503                  try:

 612                  except Exception, e:

 614                          str(e), str(flags)) 
 615                      return False

 617              #                   ENCRYPT

 621                      if not isinstance(x509_crypt_certfiles, (list, tuple)): 
 622                          x509_crypt_certfiles = [x509_crypt_certfiles]

 634                          tmp_bio.write(payload_in.as_string()) 
 635                      p7 = s.encrypt(tmp_bio)

 637                      self.error = "Something went wrong on encrypting: <%s>" % str(e) 
 638                      return False 
 639   
 640              #                 Final stage in sign and encryption 
 641              out = BIO.MemoryBuffer() 
 642              if encrypt: 
 643                  s.write(out, p7) 
 644              else:

 650              out.close() 
 651              st = str(out.read()) 
 652              payload = message_from_string(st) 
 653          else: 
 654              # no cryptography process as usual 
 655              payload = payload_in

 674          try:

 676                  logger.warn('email not sent\n%s\nFrom: %s\nTo: %s\nSubject: %s\n\n%s\n%s\n' %

1023      """ 
1024      Class for authentication, authorization, role based access control. 
1025   
1026      Includes: 
1027   
1028      - registration and profile 
1029      - login and logout 
1030      - username and password retrieval 
1031      - event logging 
1032      - role creation and assignment 
1033      - user defined group/role based permission 
1034   
1035      Authentication Example: 
1036   
1037          from gluon.contrib.utils import * 
1038          mail=Mail() 
1039          mail.settings.server='smtp.gmail.com:587' 
1040          mail.settings.sender='you@somewhere.com' 
1041          mail.settings.login='username:password' 
1042          auth=Auth(db) 
1043          auth.settings.mailer=mail 
1044          # auth.settings....=... 
1045          auth.define_tables() 
1046          def authentication(): 
1047              return dict(form=auth()) 
1048   
1049      exposes: 
1050   
1051      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/login 
1052      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/logout 
1053      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/register 
1054      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/verify_email 
1055      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_username 
1056      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_password 
1057      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/reset_password 
1058      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/profile 
1059      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/change_password 
1060   
1061      On registration a group with role=new_user.id is created 
1062      and user is given membership of this group. 
1063   
1064      You can create a group with: 
1065   
1066          group_id=auth.add_group('Manager', 'can access the manage action') 
1067          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'access to manage') 
1068   
1069      Here \"access to manage\" is just a user defined string. 
1070      You can give access to a user: 
1071   
1072          auth.add_membership(group_id, user_id) 
1073   
1074      If user id is omitted, the logged in user is assumed 
1075   
1076      Then you can decorate any action: 
1077   
1078          @auth.requires_permission('access to manage') 
1079          def manage(): 
1080              return dict() 
1081   
1082      You can restrict a permission to a specific table: 
1083   
1084          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable) 
1085          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable) 
1086   
1087      Or to a specific record: 
1088   
1089          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable, 45) 
1090          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable, 45) 
1091   
1092      If authorization is not granted calls: 
1093   
1094          auth.settings.on_failed_authorization 
1095   
1096      Other options: 
1097   
1098          auth.settings.mailer=None 
1099          auth.settings.expiration=3600 # seconds

1570                  'modified_on' in fieldnames and 
1571                  not current_record in fieldnames): 
1572                  table._enable_record_versioning(

1960              elif isinstance(basic_auth_realm, (unicode, str)):

1962              elif basic_auth_realm is True:

1965                         **{'WWW-Authenticate': u'Basic realm="' + basic_realm + '"'})

1971          is_valid_user = sep and self.login_bare(username, password) 
1972          if not is_valid_user and basic_auth_realm: 
1973              raise http_401 
1974          return (True, True, is_valid_user)

2708 -    def random_password(self): 

2709          import string 
2710          import random 
2711          password = '' 
2712          specials = r'!#$*' 
2713          for i in range(0, 3): 
2714              password += random.choice(string.lowercase) 
2715              password += random.choice(string.uppercase) 
2716              password += random.choice(string.digits) 
2717              password += random.choice(specials) 
2718          return ''.join(random.sample(password, len(password)))
